a.title: Press enter to skip to the Navigation

span.span: Based on the recent action of Governor Greg Abbott, Weimar ISD campuses and school activities will be closed until May 4, 2020. Your continued support in the days ahead is greatly appreciated.
Weekly assignments are due each Friday, and may be picked up all day at each respective campus on Fridays. Weimar ISD meals continue to be served Mon - Fri from 11:30 am - 12:30 pm.

span.style: font-family: 'comic sans ms', sans-serif; font-size: 18px; color: #1c1e21;

p.span: If you would like to pick up your child's routine and/or emergency medication from school, please contact Leslie Kloesel, RN at lkloesel@weimarisd.org. Mrs. Kloesel will make arrangements with you to pick up your child's medication.

span.style: font-family: 'comic sans ms', sans-serif; font-size: 18px; color: #7030a0;
span.span: The Weimar ISD community must work together to fight COVID-19. Head to

span.style: background-color: #e5f1f6; font-family: 'comic sans ms', sans-serif; font-size: 18px; color: #7030a0;

p.span: for vitally important public health guidance to stop the spread. If we stand apart as a community now, we will be together again soon.
Please practice Patience, Kindness, and Safety!

span.style: font-size: large; font-family: 'comic sans ms', sans-serif; color: #222222;

p.span: This is a quickly changing situation, and we

span.style: font-family: 'comic sans ms', sans-serif; font-size: 18px; color: #222222;
font-size: large; font-family: 'comic sans ms', sans-serif; color: #222222;

p.span: to monitor information, assess conditions throughout the week, and provide updates as conditions change. We have a general information page specifically dedicated to COVID-19 topics as related to our educational community. This page is located at the link below.

span.style: font-size: large; font-family: 'comic sans ms', sans-serif; color: #222222;

p.span: Thank you for your support and cooperation as we ensure that all members of the community in Weimar ISD stay safe and healthy.

p.a: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

br.a: Texas Department of State Health Services
Colorado County Emergency Management Facebook page
Additional Guidance on Closure per Executive Order

span.style: background-color: #ffffff; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; color: #7030a0;
span.strong: We love and miss our students smiling faces

span.strong: Senior Graduation Biography Form. Must be completed by all seniors and emailed to lfisbeck@weimarisd.org or dleppin@weimarisd.org or can be returned in instructional packets.

div.div:
Jon Wunderlich, Superintendent
Weimar Independent School District
506 West Main Street
Weimar, Texas 78962
Phone: 979.725.9504

Weimar ISD shall be a community nurturing academic excellence for all students and demonstrating leadership in character development. Students’ potential will be maximized in order to grow life-long learners and productive citizens.
